meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of a book
meanings.sent1: She read bookishly, with her nose buried in the pages.
meanings.sent2: He spoke bookishly, quoting passages from famous novels.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat bookishly on the shelf, pretending to be a literary critic.
meanings.sent4: The old library stood bookishly, its walls filled with stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The student walked bookishly through the aisles, absorbing the knowledge around him.

meanings.definition: Showing a love for books or reading
meanings.sent1: Her bookishly decorated room was filled with shelves of novels.
meanings.sent2: The bookishly dressed librarian greeted us with a warm smile.
meanings.sent3: The bookishly inclined group discussed their favorite authors over tea.
meanings.sent4: The bookishly themed cafe was a cozy spot for literary enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: His bookishly curated collection of first editions was the envy of his friends.
